item.title: By: Mark Bridge
item.dc:creator: Mark Bridge
item.description: Great list, really like making things intuitive and easily navigable using human wayfinding paradigms. Paths for experts, already familiar with tools and databases, and those new, for whom finding materials can be frustrating and daunting.
item.content:encoded: Great list, really like making things intuitive and easily navigable using human wayfinding paradigms. Paths for experts, already familiar with tools and databases, and those new, for whom finding materials can be frustrating and daunting.

item.title: By: Gail Persily
item.dc:creator: Gail Persily
item.description:
Great to see these principles articulated. I'm very big on #3. How can we de-emphasize the exceptions and give people the basic info that will work in majority of cases?
And here-here on #7 as Jim mentioned above.
I look forward to hearing more about these efforts as they move forward.
item.content:encoded:
Great to see these principles articulated. I’m very big on #3. How can we de-emphasize the exceptions and give people the basic info that will work in majority of cases?

And here-here on #7 as Jim mentioned above.

I look forward to hearing more about these efforts as they move forward.

item.title: By: Jim Munson
item.dc:creator: Jim Munson
item.description: Michele – Love the Principles, particularly #7! Also, kind of in line with the innovative thing, I know I’m always drawn to websites that have a sense of fun about them.
item.content:encoded: Michele – Love the Principles, particularly #7! Also, kind of in line with the innovative thing, I know I’m always drawn to websites that have a sense of fun about them.
